Deployment planning: Before deploying any asset, establish a forecasted budget based on expected cloud allocation. Ensure that ownership and accounting information for the deployment is documented.

Annual planning: On an annual basis, perform a roll-up analysis on all deployed and to-be-deployed assets. Align budgets by business units, departments, teams, and other appropriate divisions to empower self-service adoption. Ensure that the leader of each billing unit is aware of the budget and how to track spending.

Quarterly planning: On a quarterly basis, review budgets with each billing unit leader to align forecast and actual spending. If there are changes to the plan or unexpected spending patterns, align and reallocate the budget.

Education and training: On a bimonthly basis, offer training sessions to make sure business and IT staff are up-to-date on the latest Cost Management policy requirements. As part of this process review and update any documentation, guidance, or other training assets to ensure they are in sync with the latest corporate policy statements.
Monthly reporting: On a monthly basis, report actual spending against forecast. Notify billing leaders of any unexpected deviations.

Task Name: Generate WDAC reports for SMO Team
Task Description: Generate periodic reports using pre-defined KQL queries in the Defender portal Advanced Hunting section, then send the exported reports to SMO Team for review. This includes a Publisher report and a Hash report

Task Name: Generate WDAC reports for ongoing BAU management
Task Description: Generate periodic reports using pre-defined KQL queries in the Defender portal Advanced Hunting section, then store the expored reports for use in support of ongoing WDAC management activities

Task Name: SMO Team review of WDAC reports
Task Description: SMO Team review of the reports created in the 'Generate WDAC reports for SMO Team' task, returning the reports with any SMO decision on WDAC rule changes needed

Task Name: Field queries from SMO Team on WDAC report contents
Task Description: Answer queries from SMO Team in terms of the WDAC reports provided to them, such as potential data issues or inconsistencies

Task Name: Review new 'Issuers' for previously approved WDAC publishers
Task Description: Review the detailed publisher KQL report generated in the 'Generate WDAC reports for ongoing BAU management' task to identify any new Issuers (or existing Issuers for which an 'IssuerTBSHash' value has now been captured) for publishers which have already been approved by SMO, so that additional WDAC rules can be added to cover these new combinations

Task Name: Manage the WDAC rule decision log
Task Description: Receive decisions from SMO Team on new WDAC rules per the 'SMO Team review of WDAC reports' task, incorporate output from the 'Review new signers for previously approved publishers' tank, and update the decision log accordingly using information also from the 'Generate WDAC reports for ongoing BAU management' task

Task Name: Update WDAC KQL lists and queries to incorporate rule decisions
Task Description: Update the lists and the associated WDAC KQL reports they underpin, without which it would not be clear which software has already been assessed and which is new

Task Name: SMO Team request for change to WDAC KQL report format
Task Description: SMO Team request for a change to be made to one of the regular WDAC KQL reports they receive, such as the capture of more detailed information (for example specific hostnames relating to an executable file)

Task Name: SMO Team request for ad-hoc WDAC KQL query to answer a specific question
Task Description: SMO Team request for an ad-hoc WDAC KQL query to provide additional data insupport of coming to a specific rule decision - or alternatively the ability for the SMO Team to directly run such queries themselves

Task Name: Update or create new KQL queries/reports to improve WDAC process effectiveness and efficieny, or to address specific questions
Task Description: Identify through use and lessons learned opportunities to improve the existing WDAC KQL ad-hoc queries and formal reports so that the WDAC processes can be made more effective and efficient, and then updating/creating accordingly - including responding to the need for ad-hoc queries by SMO Team

Task Name: Version and naming control on the WDAC policies and associated PowerShell scripts and KQL queries
Task Description: Version and naming control across all WDAC technical artefacts - in particular WDAC policies, PowerShell scripts, and KQL queries - as they change over time, including ensuring that WDAC policy bundles (a base policy with one or more supplemental policies) are aligned in terms of their policy version iteration within the policy name for analytics purposes.

Task Name: Generate new WDAC policies to incorporate rule change decisions
Task Description: Generate new WDAC policies based on changes in the WDAC rule decision log or from elsewhere, including potentially four eyes validation for significant changes. This can include new versions of existing policies, or completely new policies such as when rules need to be targeted to only a subset of the business. First the XML version of a policy is updated with the rule changes, and then a PowerShell command is run to generate the compiled verison of the policy which is actually to be deployed.

Task Name: Test new WDAC policies and PowerShell scripts prior to wider release
Task Description: Apply the new compiled WDAC policy files or updated PowerShell scripts to a test device to ensure that there is no service impacting regression

Task Name: Propose & agree structure changes for targeting WDAC policies and configuration
Task Description: Based on lessons learned agree changes to the structure of the targeting of WDAC policies and configuration to different user populations, including such things as the need for supplemental WDAC policies targeted only to specific device groups based on user roles (eg. to allow restricted software), or Managed Installers such as dev tools which should only target developer devices.

Task Name: Create new AD groups for targeting of WDAC policies and associated PowerShell scripts
Task Description: Create new on-prem AD groups (synced to Azure AD) necessary to support the desired/sensible structure for targeting WDAC policies and configuration to different user populations, following on from the 'Agree proposed structure changes for targeting WDAC policies and configuration' task

Task Name: Add/remove devices from WDAC AD groups
Task Description: Add and remove Win 10 devices in relation to different WDAC AD groups in order to change the targeting of WDAC policies and configuraiton, including potentially adding devices to rollback groups which result in removal of the policies/configuraiton in the event of service impacts.

Task Name: Create new Intune policies for the application of new WDAC policies and associated PowerShell scripts
Task Description: Create new Intune policies of 'Configuration profile' Custom OMA-URI type for the application of new WDAC policies, and new Intune policies of 'Script' type for delivery of associated PowerShell scripts, aligned to the targeting of policies and configuration through AD groups per the 'Create new AD groups for targeting of WDAC policies and associated PowerShell scripts' task

Task Name: Update existing Intune policies for the application of updated versions of WDAC policies and associated PowerShell scripts
Task Description: Update existing Intune policies of 'Configuration profile' Custom OMA-URI type to upload revised versions of WDAC policies, and existing Intune policies of 'Script' type to upload revised versions of PowerShell scripts

Task Name: Monitor success of WDAC policy and associated configuration deployment
Task Description: Review dashboards in Intune and run KQL reports in Defender portal to monitor the success or otherwise of WDAC policy and associated configuration deployment

Task Name: Troubleshoot WDAC policy and associated configuration deployment
Task Description: Troubleshoot failed WDAC policy and associated configuration deployment, or endpoint issues which are perceived to be caused by such deployments, including carrying out troubleshooting activies in Intune and on the endpoints themselves

Task Name: Triage user tickets relating to software blocked by WDAC
Task Description: As is currently done for AppLocker, triage user tickets that come into ServiceNow helpdesk relating to software which is being blocked, including running KQL queries in Defender portal to view the block events for the Win 10 device in question, determining which specific events relate to the software the user wants to run, and then initiating the SMO Team process to seek approval one or more new WDAC rules to be created

Task Name: IT request for WDAC rules for new software not being deployed by approved Managed Installers
Task Description: As not all software is deployed through SCCM or Intune (the two tools currently approved as WDAC Managed Installers) there will be a need for ad-hoc IT requests to be raised for WDAC rules for new software not being deployed through those routes once it has been identified that the software is not fully permitted to run by the existing WDAC policy

Task Name: SMO Team review of ad-hoc requests for WDAC rules
Task Description: SMO Team to review and provide a decision on the ad-hoc requests for WDAC rules that come out of either the 'Triage user tickets relating to software blocked by WDAC' task or the 'IT request for WDAC rules for new software not being deployed by approved Managed Installers' task

Task Name: Run commands on local workstations when Defender events are inadequate for WDAC triage
Task Description: In the rare instance when triaging WDAC blocks per the 'Triage user tickets relating to software blocked by WDAC' task that the Defender portal events are not adequate to support the creation of the necessary rules there may be a need to run WDAC-related PowerShell commands to analyse files locally on a workstation - one potential instance being where page hashes are in use on blocked files (a scenario not yet seen), as page hash values are not captured in the Defender events

Task Name: Raise tickets with Microsoft support for any WDAC functional or event issues/bugs
Task Description: Raise tickets with Microsoft support for any issues or potantial bugs which cannot be rectified through configuration changes - an example of this seen thus far has been Defender portal not properly capturing certain WDAC events or displaying data fields in certain edge cases

Task Name: Raise need for new/changed WDAC Managed Installers for software deployment purposes
Task Description: SCCM and Intune are set as the two current approved WDAC Managed Installers (ie. any software deployed by these is acutomatically trusted by WDAC without an explicit WDAC rule), with their executable filename present in a specific configuraiton setting deployed to endpoints. If the executable file name changes for either of these, or if further software deployment tools need to be added to the Managed Installer list, there will be a need to request that an update to this configuration be made, which will then require appriopriate approvals before actioning

Task Name: Raise need for new/changed WDAC Managed Installers for software development purposes
Task Description: Due to the need for developers to be able to execute their own unsigned code on thier workstations as part of the development process the tools that they use to create those executables/DLLs (eg. link.exe within Visual Studio) will need to be designated as Managed Installers on developer workstations. As this tooling will change over time there will be a need to request that an update to this Managed Installer configuration be made, which will then require appriopriate approvals before actioning

Task Name: Update PowerShell scripts to incorporate new/changed WDAC Managed Installers
Task Description: Update PowerShell scripts to incorporate new/changed WDAC Managed Installers off the back of the 'Raise need for new/changed WDAC Managed Installers for software deployment purposes' task or 'Raise need for new/changed WDAC Managed Installers for software development purposes' task

Task Name: Sign-off on use of WDAC Path rules or other fundamental rule approach changes
Task Description: The use of WDAC Path rules is not as yet decided upon per the Rule Principles section 6.3 of the WDAC HLD, and is dependent on the outcome of the broad WDAC audit-mode data capture and analysis exercise and the practicality of relying on only Publisher and Hash rules. Use of any Path rules would require special sign-off due to their less granular nature which has particular ramifications for EP2/3 users who could install software into those paths.
Ensure the WDAC design documentation remains up to date in terms of approach taken
Ensure the WDAC process documentation remains up to date in terms of approach taken

Task Name: Identify and assess any new Microsoft root certificates for addition to WDAC base policies
Task Description: Periodically identify and assess any new Microsoft root certificates that should be incorporated into base policies as Microsoft transitions from older certificates to newer. Such additional roots can be identified by running the latest version of the Microsoft WDAC Wizard tool, generating base policy and reviewing the root publisher rules in it against those within the bank base policies to identify any new rules to be added

Task Name: Identify and assess any new Microsoft-recommended explicit WDAC block rules for commonly abused Microsoft applications
Task Description: Periodically identify and assess any new Microsoft-recommended explicit WDAC block rules for Microsoft applications that can be abused by threat actors to bypass application whitelisting controls such as WDAC. Such rules can be identified by running the latest version of the Microsoft WDAC Wizard tool and reviewing the output when enabling the 'Merge with Recommended User Mode Block Rules' option. Consideration would then need to be made as to how such new rules could be introduced safely, noting that some of these apps may be in legitimate use in the bank

Task Name: Identify and assess any new Microsoft-recommended explicit WDAC block rules for known-malicious or vulnerable drivers
Task Description: Periodically identify and assess any new Microsoft-recommended explicit WDAC block rules for known-malicious or vulnerable drivers. Such rules can be identified by running the latest version of the Microsoft WDAC Wizard tool and reviewing the output when enabling the 'Merge with Recommended Kernel Block Rules' option
Recurring meetings between stakeholders in the WDAC service to ensure continued alignment

Task Name: Security operations review of WDAC block events
Task Description: In the event that SOC is running a monitoring use case relating to WDAC block events those event would require periodic review, involving activities in Sentinel and/or Microsoft 365 Defender portal. Many WDAC block events could be down to software which while unapproved is not malicious, so a SOC review approach would need to take into account all scenarios

Task Name: Policy cleanup through removal of stale WDAC rules
Task Description: Optional but recommended activity, carrying out periodic cleanup of WDAC rules which are no longer required, such as publisher rules for publishers no longer seen in use over an extended period in the bank, utilising a combination of KQL reports and secondary WDAC policies in audit mode running in parallel with the main WDAC policy in blocking mode.

Task Name: Review new WDAC settings/capabilities of potential value
Task Description: WDAC is under active improvement by Microsoft, with new settings and additional capabilities released within some new Windows builds. Any such improvements should be periodically reviewed to determine their potential value in terms of such things as enhanced security or manageability, and factored into a bank WDAC improvement roadmap

Task Name: Expand WDAC policies to cover additional supported file types, or introduce other new WDAC capabilities
Task Description: Expand the WDAC configuration and rules to cover additional supported file types such as Scripts, Windows Installers, and Packaged/Store apps, to further enhance security

Task Description: The BCL is added to the message in an X-header and is similar to the spam confidence level (SCL) that's used to identify messages as spam. A higher BCL indicates a bulk message is more likely to generate complaints (and is therefore more likely to be spam). Microsoft uses both internal and third party sources to identify bulk mail and determine the appropriate BCL.
Documentation Link: Bulk complaint level values - Office 365 | Microsoft Docs

Task Description: ASF specifically targets these properties because they're commonly found in spam. Depending on the property, ASF detections will either mark the message as Spam or High confidence spam.
Documentation Link: ASF settings in EOP - Office 365 | Microsoft Docs

Task Description: Outbound spam from a user in your organization typically indicates a compromised account. Suspicious outbound messages are marked as spam (regardless of the spam confidence level or SCL) and are routed through the high-risk delivery pool to help protect the reputation of the service (that is, keep Microsoft 365 source email servers off of IP block lists)
Documentation Link: Configure outbound spam filtering - Office 365 | Microsoft Docs

Task Name: Support existing users/devicers not yet installed with Defender
Task Description: There are some 5,500 devices installed with Defender and there is a small number still with installation pending, this will need to be managed. Manage the installation of the remaining devices pending installation, (circa 250 devices). Some may not need to have defender installed, (off network devices, eg long-term illness)

Task Name: Support users with challenges or issues on Defender on their Mobile Devices
Task Description: Currently incidents/issues are addressed to the project and these are manged by Asim. There are roughly 5 incidents per week, these are communicated via email and there are no tickets logged. These need to be transitioned to Kyndryl

Task Name: Monitor and manage Health Alerts from Defender for Mobile
Task Description: The Health of Defender on Mobile Devices needs to be monitored and managed to ensure that Defender is actively protecting Mobile Devices.

Task Name: Monitor and managed Mobile Devices that have Defender activated and thoise that do not have Defender activated
Task Description: The current policy does not enforce users to have Defender switched on. There needs to be a periodic review of the devices that have Defender switched on and those that have Defender switched off. This reprot will be provided to BOI management for review and action. (Consideration is underway to move to Apple Business Manager and this will enforce Defender usage.)
